document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue and Weight Loss

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: I am referring Ms. Lydia Harper, a 35-year-old female, to Internal Medicine for further evaluation of persistent fatigue and unintentional weight loss over the past three months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: Ms. Harper reports progressive fatigue, generalized weakness, and a 6 kg unintentional weight loss since February 2025. She denies fever, night sweats, or recent travel. No significant gastrointestinal, respiratory, or neurological symptoms reported.

sections.heading: Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic medical conditions. No previous hospitalizations or surgeries. Not currently on any regular medications.

sections.heading: Family and Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker. Social alcohol use. Works as a graphic designer. No family history of malignancy, autoimmune disorders, or endocrine diseases.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: On examination, Ms. Harper appears thin but is in no acute distress. Vitals stable. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly. Cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal exams unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Basic blood work (CBC, metabolic panel, thyroid function tests) showed mild normocytic anemia (Hb 10.8 g/dL), otherwise within normal limits. Further workup including inflammatory markers and infectious screening is pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the unexplained symptoms and mild anemia, I request your assessment for possible underlying systemic or metabolic causes. Please advise on further investigations and management.
